definition: lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Any company that cuts back on research and development is killing the goose that lays the golden egg.
sentences.chinese: 那些削減科研費用的公司，等於是在殺雞取卵。

sentences.english: If had the day I to walk, you left no ground forgot me.
sentences.chinese: 假若有天我走了，你就殺雞取卵的把我忘掉。

sentences.english: Emmy, you don't want to take the eggs out of that nest.
sentences.chinese: 艾美，你不想做殺雞取卵的事吧。

sentences.english: That will be killing the goose that lays the golden egg.
sentences.chinese: 那就成了殺雞取卵，只顧眼前。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
